intro: Alsine akinfiewii, commonly known as the African sand grass, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Namibia and Botswana. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Alsine akinfiewii is often found in coastal dunes and is considered an important component of desert ecosystems.
